page.description: Zip a table. Options "d" - include Dictionary, "x" - include Indexes, "p" - display prompt dialog.
page.original:
TABLE.ZIP() Syntax TABLE.ZIP( Table_Name as C [, Zipfile_Name as C [, Options as C ]] ) ArgumentDescription Table_NameThe table to put into the zip file. If the table is in the current database, it is not necessary to specify the full drive and path. Zipfile_NameOptional. Default = Table_Name with the .ZIP extension. The name of the zip file to create. OptionsOptional. Options is a string that can include one or more of the following flags: Option FlagMeaning CCompress (pack) the table before zipping. PDisplay the "Zip Table" dialog box. If "P" not specified, the table is zipped without any user prompting. DInclude the data dictionary files. XInclude index file.
Description The TABLE.ZIP() method creates a zip file containing the table specified by Table_Name. If the table specified by Table_Name is in the current database, it is not necessary to specify the full drive and path. Note : To zip a set, use the .ZIP() method. Example This script zips a table and includes the dictionary and indexes. table.zip("c:\mydata\customers","","DX")
